title: Photocatalytic Material Design: Role and Application of Surface Defects

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Chemistry and Materials Science Knowledge, with Understanding of Photocatalytic Reaction Mechanisms
context.additional_context: Intensive modular design accommodating time constraints of working learners, supplemented by smartphone-based materials.

learning_goals: They can explain at least three types of surface defects (voids, doping, structural deformations) and factors affecting photocatalytic performance
They can analyze the role of defects in four representative photocatalytic reactions (e.g., H₂ production, CO₂ reduction) by connecting experimental data
They can apply and propose cutting-edge defect control strategies (e.g., atomic-level defect control, machine learning design) to real-world cases

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
